text: The 2015–16 GET-ligaen was the 77th and season of Norway's premier ice hockey league, Eliteserien (known as GET-ligaen for sponsorship reasons). The regular season began play on September 12, 2015, and was concluded on March 8, 2016,. The playoffs to determine the 2016 Norwegian Ice Hockey Champions began March 11, and ended 22 April 2016. ==Participating teams== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Team ! City ! Arena ! Average ! % of Capacity |- align="center" |align="left"| Frisk Tigers ||align="left"| Askerhallen || 2,400 || || || || |- align="center" |align="left"| Stavanger Oilers ||align="left"| DNB Arena || 4,377 || || || || |- align="center" |align="left"| Storhamar Dragons ||align="left"| Hamar OL-Amfi || 6,091 || || || || |- align="center" |align="left"| Vålerenga ||align="left"| Jordal Amfi || 4,450 || || || || |- align="center" |align="left"| Kongsvinger Knights ||align="left"| Kongsvinger Ishall || 2,000 || || || || |- align="center" |align="left"| Lillehammer ||align="left"| Kristins Hall || 3,194 || || || || |- align="center" |align="left"| Lørenskog ||align="left"| Lørenskog Ishall || 1,350 || || || || |- align="center" |align="left"| Manglerud Star ||align="left"| Manglerudhallen || 2,000 || || || || |- align="center" |align="left"| Sparta Warriors ||align="left"| Sparta Amfi || 3,450 || || || || |- align="center" |align="left"| Stjernen ||align="left"| Stjernehallen || 2,473 || || || || |} Source:pointstreak.com ==Playoffs== After the regular season, the top eight teams qualified for the playoffs. In the first and second rounds, the highest remaining seed chose which of the two lowest remaining seeds to be matched against. In each round the higher-seeded team was awarded home ice advantage. Each best-of-seven series followed a 1–1–1–1–1–1–1 format: the higher-seeded team played at home for games 1 and 3 (plus 5 and 7 if necessary), and the lower-seeded team at home for games 2, 4 and (if necessary) 6. ===Bracket=== Updated as of April 22, 2016. Source: pointstreak.com {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; margin: 0 auto; width: 20%" |- !Norwegian Champions 2016 |- |Stavanger Oilers 6th title |} ==Qualification== After the regular season has ended, the two lowest ranked teams in the league and the two highest ranked teams in the 2015–16 1. division competed for the right to play in the 2016-17 GET-ligaen. The tournament was organized according to a double round robin format, where each club played the others twice, home and away, for a total of six games. The points system and ranking method used, was the same as in the GET-ligaen. ===Standings=== Updated as of March 22, 2016. {| class="wikitable" ! style="width:18em;" | 2016–17 GET-ligaen playoffs ! style="width:3em;" | ! style="width:3em;" | ! style="width:3em;" | ! style="width:3em;" | ! style="width:3em;" | ! style="width:3em;" | ! style="width:3em;" | ! style="width:3em;" | ! style="width:3em;" | |- align=center |align=left| Lillehammerq || 6 || 5 || 1 || 0 || 0 || 26 || 7 || +19 || 15 |- align=center |align=left| Kongsvinger Knightsq || 6 || 3 || 2 || 1 || 0 || 24 || 18 || +6 || 11 |- bgcolor="#cccccc" class="unsortable" |colspan=10| |- align=center |align=left| Tønsberg Vikingsr || 6 || 2 || 3 || 0 || 1 || 14 || 21 || -7 || 7 |- align=center |align=left| Bergenr || 6 || 1 || 5 || 0 || 0 || 19 || 37 || -18 || 3 |} q – qualified for next years GET-league; r – will play in next years 1. division Source: hockey.no ==Awards== All-Star team The following players were selected to the 2015-16 GET-ligaen All-Star team: *Goaltender: Nicklas Dahlberg (Frisk) *Defenseman: Curtis Gedig (Stjernen) *Defenseman: Stefan Espeland (Lørenskog) *Center: Josh Soares (Stavanger) *Winger: Dion Knelsen (Sparta) *Winger: Jacob Berglund (Storhamar) Other *Coach of the year: Sune Bergman (Frisk) *Rookie of the year: Johannes Johannessen (Stavanger) ==References== ==External links== * 2015-16 Nor GET-ligaen
title: 2015–16 GET-ligaen season
